intro: Echinops nistrii, commonly known as the Persian thistle, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny, spherical seed heads that resemble a hedgehog. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, hot climates. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Echinops nistrii is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
